info.title: Wpay APIs
info.description: Wpay APIs for payments and gifting

get.description: Get a list of the previously executed transactions for the customer.  Note that amounts are relative to the merchant.  A positive amount is a positive amount transferred to a merchant

parameters.name: X-Api-Key
parameters.description: The API key for the request. The API keys (non-prod/prod) will be supplied by the Digital Pay team.

parameters.name: X-Auth-Key
parameters.description: (Deprecated) You are required to use this header to provide the base64 encoded API key. Requires the X-Auth-Digest header to be present.

parameters.name: X-Auth-Digest
parameters.description: (Deprecated) You are required to use this header to provide the encrypted API key. The value is the API key encrypted with the client secret key. Requires the X-Auth-Key header to be present.

parameters.name: X-Message-Id
parameters.description: This id is used to keep track of the request and its response in the Digital Pay platform. If no value is provided for the request header, Apigee will auto generate an id to use for the request. This header will also be returned in the response and will have the value passed in (or auto generated) from the request.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The Bearer token for the request. The Bearer token authentication approach can be used by API consumers that implement a client-to-server architecture (mobile app, browser site/page) or server-to-server architecture (BFF, microservice, web server, etc.) for calling Digital Pay APIs. However the Bearer token for a shopper/customer must be obtained from the IDM Server Token API which can only be accessed from a server-to-server architecture (BFF, microservice, web server, etc.). The Authorization header is only required if the X-JWS-Signature header is not present.

parameters.name: X-JWS-Signature
parameters.description: The JWS signature used to sign the request. The JWS signature authentication approach can only be used by API consumers that implement a server-to-server architecture (BFF, microservice, web server, etc.) for calling the Digital Pay APIs. The RSA private key, required to generate the signiture, has to be stored securely and should not be publicly accessible. The X-JWS-Signature header is only required if the Authorization header is not present.

parameters.name: paymentRequestId
parameters.description: If present, limits the list of transactions to those that relate to the payment request

parameters.name: start-time
parameters.description: If present, the date/time to limit transactions returned.  Transactions older than this time will not be returned

parameters.name: end-time
parameters.description: If present, the date/time to limit transactions returned.  Transactions newer than this time will not be returned

parameters.name: page-size
parameters.description: The number of records to return for this page.  Defaults to 25 if absent

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of results to return with 1 indicating the first page.  Defaults to 1 if absent

get.description: Get the details for a specific transaction previously executed by the customer.  Note that amounts are relative to the merchant.  A positive amount is a positive amount transferred to a merchant

parameters.name: X-Everyday-Pay-Wallet
parameters.description: A flag to indicate if the Everyday Pay wallet should be used when processing the API request. Set the header value to "true" to use the Everyday Pay wallet. Set the header value to "false" or exclude the header completely to use the default merchant wallet.

parameters.name: publicKey
parameters.description: The optional ephemeral public key used to encrypt sensitive instrument data and include ('cipherText' in the 'meta' object) that encrypted data in the response sent back to the consumer. If this parameter is omitted the sensitive data is NOT returned in the response to the consumer.

The Authorization header is only required if the X-JWS-Signature header is not present.

responseFormat.description: The fraud check response message format.

items.description: The response to a step up challenge (e.g. credit card step up or gift card passcode)

instrumentId.description: The instrument id related to the step up challenge

type.description: The type of token that has been provided

token.description: The value requested by the challenge

reference.description: An optional reference that could be used for audit tracing

items.description: The object containing callback url data

id.description: Unique id related to callback url

cipherText.description: An encrypted JSON object containing sensitive data

preferencesCustomer.description: Available preference settings for a customer

primaryInstrumentId.description: The primary instrument that will be used by default for a payment if a specific instrument is not specified.  The primary instrument will be used for the balance of the payment after any specified secondary instruments are used first.

secondaryInstruments.description: Rules for the creation of a default set of secondary instruments to be used for a payment if a specific set is not specified.  Secondary instruments are used in order until the full amount of the payment has been paid.

enableSecondaryInstruments.description: Flag indicating whether secondary instruments are enabled or disabled.  If not present defaults to enabled.  Used to specifically disable secondary instruments without losing customer configure preferences.

order.description: The order that the secondary instruments will be used for a specific payment.

exclude.description: Array of instruments to exclude from the secondary instruments set.  Indicates that the set of secondary instruments should include all valid instruments excluding those in this list.

include.description: Array of instruments to specifically include in the secondary instruments set.  Indicates that the set of secondary instruments should start as empty and only include all valid instruments excluding those in this list.

preferenceGroup.description: A set of groups of key/value based preferences

additionalProperties.description: A group or category of preferences

qrId.description: The ID of the QR code

referenceId.description: The ID of the payment request linked to this QR code

referenceType.description: The type of ID held in referenceId

content.description: The text content for the QR code.  The template used in creating this value can be overriden using merchant preferences.

image.description: Base64 encoded PNG of the QR Code

expiryTime.description: ISO date/time string indicating when the QR code will expire and become ineffective.  If absent then the QR code will not expire until it is deleted

basket.description: Information provided by the Merchant on the basket of items associated with the payment request.  This payload originates in the payment request and is carried with any resulting transactions

items.description: An array of items in the basket

label.description: Short label for the basket item

description.description: Longer description of the basket item

quantity.description: The number of units of the item in the basket if multiple is possible.  Is a number to accommodate items charged by weight or length

unitPrice.description: The unit price of the item.  May be positive or negative

unitMeasure.description: Optional display string for the measure of the unit

totalPrice.description: The total price of the item.  May be positive or negative

tags.description: Additional string/string key/value pairs for the item defined by the merchant

instrumentAllocation.description: An instrument used for this transaction

paymentInstrumentId.description: The ID of the payment instrument

instrumentType.description: The type of the payment instrument.

transactions.description: The list of transactions associated with the instrument.  If no results match the request then an empty array will be returned

type.description: The type of transaction: PAYMENT or REFUND

executionTime.description: Date/time stamp of when the transaction occurred in ISO string format

paymentTransactionRef.description: The reference for the payment.  If a refund this is the reference to the transaction being refunded

status.description: The current status of the transactions

amount.description: The amount charged against or refunded to this instrument

posPayload.description: Payload describing the specific POS system.  This payload originates in the payment request and is carried with any resulting transactions.  Provided in a generic schema previous configured by the merchant

schemaId.description: The ID of the previously configured schema that will be used to validate the contents of the payload

payload.description: The ID of the previously configured schema that will be used to validate the contents of the payload

merchantPayload.description: Payload provided by the merchant to support other types of messaging.  This payload originates in the payment request and is carried with any resulting transactions.  Provided in a generic schema previous configured by the merchant

schemaId.description: The ID of the previously configured schema that will be used to validate the contents of the payload

payload.description: The ID of the previously configured schema that will be used to validate the contents of the payload

paymentRequestId.description: The ID of this payment request

merchantReferenceId.description: The unique reference for the payment as defined by the Merchant

grossAmount.description: The gross amount to be paid.  Must be positive except for refunds

merchantPaymentSummary.description: Summary information for a single payment request

usesRemaining.description: The number of times that the payment request can be used to create a payment. If absent then request can be used an unlimited number of times

expiryTime.description: The ISO date/time for when the payment request will expire and become unusable for payments.  If absent then the payment request will not expire until it is deleted

specificWalletId.description: The ID of a specific wallet for which the payment is intended.  If present then the payment can only be used by the intended wallet.  If absent then any wallet can create a payment against the payment request

customerPaymentRequestDetails.description: Detailed information for a single payment request

merchantId.description: The ID of the merchant associated with this transaction

merchantPaymentDetails.description: Detailed information for a single payment request

clientReference.description: An optional client reference associated with the transaction.  If not supplied the transactionId will be used.

type.description: The type of transaction: PAYMENT or REFUND

executionTime.description: Date/time stamp of when the transaction occurred in ISO string format

status.description: The current status of the transactions

rollback.description: The rollback state of this transaction

subTransactions.description: Array of transaction responses returned by downstream processes

refundReason.description: The reason provided for the refund.  Only provided for REFUND transactions

instruments.description: The instruments used to make the payment.  For refunds and cash back amounts will be negative

customerTransactionSummary.description: Summary information of the resulting transaction

merchantId.description: The ID of the merchant associated with this transaction

merchantTransactionSummary.description: Summary information of the resulting transaction

walletId.description: The ID of the wallet associated with this transaction

customerTransactionDetail.description: Detailed information for a single transaction

customerTermsAndConditionsAcceptance.description: The Ts and Cs the customer has accepted.

type.description: The type of the Ts and Cs.

version.description: The version of the Ts and Cs.

timestamp.description: The timestamp when the shopper/customer agreed to the Everyday Pay Ts and Cs.  The timestamp format is milliseconds since epoch.

merchantTransactionDetail.description: Detailed information for a single transaction

schemaId.description: The unique ID assigned to the newly created schema

type.description: The type of the schema e.g. pos, merchant

created.description: The ISO date/time when the schema was created

paymentSessionId.description: The ID of the payment session

paymentRequestId.description: The ID of the associated payment request

merchantId.description: The ID of the merchant initiating the payment session

walletId.description: The ID of the customers wallet

expiryTime.description: The ISO date/time for when the payment session will expire and become unusable

location.description: The location of the payment session (Used to group payment sessions)

merchantInfo.description: Payload used to pass merchant information to the customer

customerInfo.description: Payload used to pass customer information back to the merchant

schemaId.description: The ID of the previously configured schema that will be used to validate the contents of the payload

payload.description: The payload aligned to the supplied schema

paymentInstrumentId.description: The credit card payment instrument id.

paymentToken.description: The credit card payment token. The payment token is a unique identifier for the payment instrument.

status.description: The status of the payment instrument in the container.

lastUpdated.description: The timestamp the payment instrument was last updated in the container. The timestamp format is ISO8601.

lastUsed.description: The timestamp the payment instrument was last used in the container. The timestamp format is ISO8601. Will be null if never used.

createdOn.description: The timestamp for when the payment instrument was added. The timestamp format is ISO8601.

primary.description: A flag to indicate if this payment instrument is the primary instrument in the container.

allowed.description: A flag to indicate if the merchant profile in the container allows the use of this payment instrument.

expiryYear.description: The year of the expiry date of the credit card.

expiryMonth.description: The month of the expiry date of the credit card.

cardSuffix.description: The suffix (last 4 digits) of the credit card number.

cvvValidated.description: A flag to indicate if the CVV of the credit card has been validated.

cardName.description: The nickname of the credit card instrument in the container.

expired.description: A flag to indicate if the credit card is expired.

requiresCVV.description: A flag to indicate if payments with this credit card requires a CVV check.

updateURL.description: The URL of an iframe. This iframe is used to capture a credit card expiry and CVV.

type.description: The type of the step up action. For credit cards this will be CAPTURE_CVV which identifies that the consumer must capture the CVV prior to payment.

mandatory.description: A flag to indicate if this step up (action) is mandatory.

url.description: The URL of an iframe. This iframe is used to capture a credit card expiry and CVV or CVV only. The URL will automatically switch between expiry and CVV or CVV only endpoints based on the container requirement.

paymentInstrumentId.description: The gift card payment instrument id.

paymentToken.description: The gift card payment token. The payment token is a unique identifier for the payment instrument.

status.description: The status of the payment instrument in the container.

lastUpdated.description: The timestamp the payment instrument was last updated in the container. The timestamp format is ISO8601.

lastUsed.description: The timestamp the payment instrument was last used in the container. The timestamp format is ISO8601. Will be null if never used.

createdOn.description: The timestamp for when the payment instrument was added. The timestamp format is ISO8601.

primary.description: A flag to indicate if this payment instrument is the primary instrument in the container.

allowed.description: A flag to indicate if the merchant profile in the container allows the use of this payment instrument.

cardSuffix.description: The suffix (last 4 digits) of the gift card number.

type.description: The type of the step up action. For gift cards this will be REQUIRE_PASSCODE which identifies that the consumer must capture the PIN prior to payment.

mandatory.description: A flag to indicate if this step up (action) is mandatory.

redemptionStores.description: The stores in which the gift card product is able to be redeemed

designs.description: Array of all alternative designs for the gift card product

giftingProductDiscount.description: A discount offered for a gift card product

quantity.description: For self use card, this can be any value between 1 and 10. For a gifting card, it must be 1

clientReference.description: A merchant application specific reference number. This number should uniquely identify the transaction in the merchants system.

paymentToken.description: The payment token.

stepUpToken.description: The step-up token is used to track additional credit card information (eg. CVV and expiry) attached to the payment instrument. It's only valid for a predefined time and if an expired step-up token is used during payment, the payment for that instrument will fail and the user will have to get a new step-up token before retrying the payment. A step-up token is returned in the response of a credit card iframe. This property is currently only required for credit card instruments and only if specific credit card information (eg. CVV and expiry) is required during payment.

creditCard.description: The container transaction type to use for credit card instruments. This property is only required if the payments request contains credit card instruments.

giftCard.description: The container transaction type to use for gift card instruments. This property is only required if the payments request contains gift card instruments.

payPal.description: The container transaction type to use for paypal instruments. This property is only required if the payments request contains paypal instruments. Only PURCHASE is currently supported for paypal instruments.

creditCard.description: The container transaction type to use for google pay credit card instruments.

debitCard.description: The container transaction type to use for google pay debit card instruments. Only PURCHASE is currently supported for google pay debit card instruments.

googlePay.description: This object is only required if the payments request contains google pay instruments.

creditCard.description: The container transaction type to use for apple pay credit card instruments.

debitCard.description: The container transaction type to use for apple pay debit card instruments. Only PURCHASE is currently supported for apple pay debit card instruments.

applePay.description: This object is only required if the payments request contains apple pay instruments.

clientReference.description: A merchant application specific reference number. This number should uniquely identify the transaction in the merchants system.

orderNumber.description: The merchant order number of the transaction.

stateOrTerritory.description: The recipient's abbreviated state or territory.

countryCode.description: The recipient's Alpha-2 (2-character) ISO-3166-1 country code.

shippingAddress.description: This object is only required if the payments request contains paypal instruments.

paymentInstrumentId.description: The payment instrument id from the card capture iframe response or the list payment instruments response. This property can be omitted if the payment token property is present.

paymentToken.description: The payment token from the card capture iframe response or the list payment instruments response. This property can be omitted if the payment instrument id property is present.

amount.description: The amount you want to pay with the payment instrument.

stepUpToken.description: The step-up token is used to track additional credit card information (eg. CVV and expiry) attached to the payment instrument. It's only valid for a predefined time and if an expired step-up token is used during payment, the payment for that instrument will fail and the user will have to get a new step-up token before retrying the payment. A step-up token is returned in the response of a credit card iframe. This property is currently only required for credit card instruments and only if specific credit card information (eg. CVV and expiry) is required during payment.

passcode.description: The passcode is used to send additional information (eg. gift card PIN) for the payment instrument. This property is currently only required for gift card instruments and only if the gift card PIN is required during payment. This property should NOT be used with credit card instruments (see stepUpToken).

controlData.description: This object is used to pass additonal control data to Digital Pay

tokenType.description: The Digital Pay token type to use for a scheme card instrument during 3DS processing for merchants that have 3DS enabled. Defaults to 'PAN' if absent.

threeDS.description: This object is only required if the payments request requires 3DS challenge response data to be sent to Digital Pay.

messageVersion.description: The Protocol Version Number of the specification utilised by the system creating this message.

xid.description: The transaction identifier. Required for Mastercard and Amex. Not applicable for Visa.

authenticationValue.description: The payment system-specific value provided by the ACS or the Directory Server (DS) using an algorithm defined by Payment System.

dsTransID.description: The Directory Server (DS) authentication identification code. A universally unique transaction identifier assigned by the DS to identify a single transaction. The format of the value is defined in IETF RFC 4122. It may utilise any of the specified versions if the output meets specific requirements.

eci.description: The electronic commerce indicator. Required for calculating the SLI. A Payment System-specific value provided by the ACS or DS to indicate the results of the attempt to authenticate the Cardholder.

aresStatus.description: The payer authentication response status. Required for Visa.
enum: N: Customer failed or canceled authentication
A: Proof of authentication attempt was generated
U: Authentication not completed regardless of the reason

veresEnrolled.description: The verification response enrollment status. Required for Visa.
enum: N: Card not enrolled, proceed with authorization
U: Unable to authenticate regardless of the reason
B: Indicates that authentication was bypassed

transStatus.description: Indicates whether a transaction qualifies as an authenticated transaction or account verification.
enum: U: Authentication could not be performed
A: Attempts Processing Performed; Not authenticated
C: Challenge Required. Additional authentication is required
D: Challenge Required; Decoupled Authentication performed
R: Authentication Rejected. Issuer is rejecting

extendedMerchantData.description: This array is only required if the payments request contains paypal instruments.

field.description: The name of the extended merchant data field.

value.description: The value of the extended merchant data field.

groupId.description: The payment transaction merchant group id. The group id is defined as a logical grouping of merchants or stores. A default configured group id is set in Apigee if absent in the payload.

terminalId.description: The in-store payment transaction terminal id. This is a 8 character alphanumeric string. If present in the payload the 'storeId' has to be omitted.

storeId.description: The in-store payment transaction store id. If present in the payload the 'terminalId' and 'stan' can be omitted.

laneId.description: The in-store payment transaction lane id.

stan.description: The System Trace Audit Number (STAN) used to identify the transaction. This is a 6 digit numeric string.

rrn.description: The in-store payment transaction store id. This is a 12 digit "0" [zero] padded numeric string.

transactionTimestamp.description: The in-store payment transaction timestamp. The timestamp format is milliseconds since epoch.

storeData.description: This object is only required if the payments request is for an in-store payment transaction.

basketData.description: This array is only required if an implicit restricted product validation (RPVS) is required during the execution of the payment for the relevant merchant. A merchant can be opted-out of this restricted product validation via configuration.

itemId.description: The item id, article id or SKU. Required if 'category' is not present.

category.description: The items category code. Required if 'itemId' is not present or, if 'subcategory' is present.

subcategory.description: The items subcategory code. Requires 'category' to be present.

description.description: The item, category or subcategory description.

responseFormat.description: The fraud check response message format.

fraudPayload.description: Set to null to skip the cybersource fraud check.

PaymentsRequest.description: The JSON request structure of the Payments endpoint.

transactionReceipt.description: Container reference in the transaction logs. This number uniquely identifies the whole/grouped transaction in the container.

partialSuccess.description: A flag to indicate if a split payment was only partially successful, ie. at least 1 of the payment instruments had a successful payment result.

clientId.description: The fraud check client id. Will be null if the fraud check was skipped.

reasonCode.description: The fraud check reason code. Will be null if the fraud check was skipped.

decision.description: The fraud check decision. Will be null if the fraud check was skipped.

paymentInstrumentId.description: The credit card payment instrument id.

paymentToken.description: The credit card payment token. The payment token is a unique identifier for the payment instrument.

paymentTransactionRef.description: Container reference in the transaction logs. This number uniquely identifies the credit card transaction in the container.

errorCode.description: The error code. Only present if an error occurred during payment.

errorMessage.description: The error message. Only present if an error occurred during payment.

errorDetail.description: The error detail. Only present if an error occurred during payment.
errorDetail.example: We are currently experiencing technical issues with our service.

type.description: The type of the step up action. For credit cards this will be CAPTURE_CVV which identifies that the consumer must capture the CVV prior to payment.

mandatory.description: A flag to indicate if this step up (action) is mandatory.

url.description: The URL of an iframe. This iframe is used to capture a credit card expiry and CVV or CVV only. The URL will automatically switch between expiry and CVV or CVV only endpoints based on the container requirement.

stepUp.description: Only present if an error occurred during payment.

cardSuffix.description: The suffix (last 4 digits) of the credit card number used in the WebPay transaction.

expiryMonth.description: The month of the expiry date of the credit card.

expiryYear.description: The year of the expiry date of the credit card.

clientReference.description: A merchant application specific reference number. This number should uniquely identify the transaction in the merchants system.

customerRef.description: A merchant application specific reference number. This number should uniquely identify the customer in the merchants system.

orderNumber.description: The merchant order number of the transaction. This property is only required if the 'immediateCharge' property is true.

stateOrTerritory.description: The customer's abbreviated state or territory.

countryCode.description: The customer's Alpha-2 (2-character) ISO-3166-1 country code.

stateOrTerritory.description: The customer's abbreviated state or territory.

countryCode.description: The customer's Alpha-2 (2-character) ISO-3166-1 country code.

type.description: The payment agreement type.

paymentInstrumentId.description: The payment agreement payment instrument id that will be used for the charges.

startDate.description: The payment agreement start date and time. The timestamp format is ISO8601.

endDate.description: The payment agreement end date and time. The timestamp format is ISO8601.

chargeAmount.description: The amount that will be charged at the frequency specified in the payment agreement.

immediateCharge.description: A flag to indicate if a charge transaction must be performed at the time of payment agreement creation. This in convenient in the cases where a customer wants to process a first charge transaction immediately at payment agreement creation.

stepUpToken.description: The step-up token is used to track additional credit card information (eg. CVV and expiry) attached to the payment instrument. It's only valid for a predefined time and if an expired step-up token is used during validation, the validation of that instrument will fail and the user will have to get a new step-up token before retrying the API call. A step-up token is returned in the response of a credit card iframe. This property is only required for credit card instruments and only if specific credit card information (eg. CVV and expiry) is required during the API call.

responseFormat.description: The fraud check response message format.

fraudPayload.description: Set to null to skip the fraud check.

stepUpToken.description: The step-up token is used to track additional credit card information (eg. CVV and expiry) attached to the payment instrument. It's only valid for a predefined time and if an expired step-up token is used during validation, the validation of that instrument will fail and the user will have to get a new step-up token before retrying the API call. paymentToken.description: The payment token of the payment agreement. The payment token is a unique identifier for the payment agreement.

status.description: The status of the payment agreement in the container.

lastUpdated.description: The timestamp the payment agreement was last updated in the container. The timestamp format is ISO8601.

lastUsed.description: The timestamp the payment agreement was last used in the container. The timestamp format is ISO8601. Will be null if never used.

createdOn.description: The timestamp for when the payment instrument was added. The timestamp format is ISO8601.

primary.description: A flag to indicate if this payment instrument is the primary instrument in the container. Not used for payment agreements.

allowed.description: A flag to indicate if the merchant profile in the container allows the use of this payment agreement.

type.description: The payment agreement type.

paymentInstrumentId.description: The payment agreement payment instrument id that will be used for the charges.

cardSuffix.description: The suffix (last 4 digits) of the credit card number.

expiryMonth.description: The month of the expiry date of the credit card.

expiryYear.description: The year of the expiry date of the credit card.

startDate.description: The payment agreement start date and time. The timestamp format is ISO8601.

endDate.description: The payment agreement end date and time. The timestamp format is ISO8601.

chargeAmount.description: The amount that will be charged at the frequency specified in the payment agreement.

expired.description: A flag to indicate if the payment agreement is expired.

updateURL.description: The URL of the endpoint to use to update the payment agreement.

type.description: The type of the step up action. For payment agreements this will be CAPTURE_CVV which identifies that the consumer must capture the CVV prior to payment.

mandatory.description: A flag to indicate if this step up (action) is mandatory.

url.description: The URL of an iframe. This iframe is used to capture a credit card expiry and CVV or CVV only. The URL will automatically switch between expiry and CVV or CVV only endpoints based on the container requirement.

description.description: A description of the payment agreement

clientReference.description: A merchant application specific reference number. This number should uniquely identify the transaction in the merchants system.

orderNumber.description: The merchant order number of the transaction.

skipRollback.description: An optional flag allowing the consumer to indicate that automatic rollback step should be skipped in the case of failure

allowPartialSuccess.description: An optional flag allowing the consumer to indicate that a partial success will not trigger a failure and rollback

paymentInstrumentId.description: The payment instrument id from the card capture iframe response or the list payment instruments response. This property can be omitted if the payment token property is present.

amount.description: The amount you want to pay with the payment instrument.

primaryInstrumentId.description: The Id of the primary instrument.  Will be used as the balance of the transaction.  If not present then the primary instrument from the customer preferences will be used.

secondaryInstruments.description: The secondary instruments (if any) used to partially make the payment.  If not present then the primary instrument from the customer preferences will be used.  To specify that no secondary instruments should be used an empty array should be provided.

items.description: An instrument used for this transaction

instrumentId.description: The ID of the payment instrument

amount.description: The amount to charged against this instrument.  Must be greater than zero

skipRollback.description: An optional flag allowing the consumer to indicate that automatic rollback step should be skipped in the case of failure

allowPartialSuccess.description: An optional flag allowing the consumer to indicate that a partial success will not trigger a failure and rollback

clientReference.description: An optional client reference to be associated with the transaction.  If not suplied the transactionId will be used.

orderItems.description: Gift cards to be included in the order.  Currently only supports a single entry.  Array is for future roadmap

instrumentId.description: The instrumentId to be used for the order.  Must not be a stored gift card

referenceId.description: Unique reference for the order supplied by the client

subTotalAmount.description: Face value of the gift card

discountAmount.description: Eligible discount amount. In case of no discounts, value will be 0

email.description: The email of the ordering customer

mobileNumber.description: The mobile number of the ordering customer

stateOrTerritory.description: The customer's abbreviated state or territory.

countryCode.description: The customer's Alpha-2 (2-character) ISO-3166-1 country code.

orderItems.description: Gift cards to be included in the order.  Currently only supports a single entry.  Array is for future roadmap

errorCode.description: The error code. Only present if an error occurred during payment.

externalServiceCode.description: The external service code (from eg. Webpay). This property is only included in the response if it is enabled in the consumers API configuration.

externalServiceMessage.description: The external service message (from eg. Webpay). This property is only included in the response if it is enabled in the consumers API configuration.

paymentRequestId.description: The ID of the new payment request

everydayPay.description: A list of payment instruments stored in the customers everydayPay wallet

paymentInstrumentId.description: The payment instrument id.

paymentToken.description: The payment token. The payment token is a unique identifier for the payment instrument.

paymentInstrumentType.description: The type of the payment instrument.

status.description: The status of the payment instrument in the container.

createdOn.description: The timestamp for when the payment instrument was added. The timestamp format is ISO8601.

lastUpdated.description: The timestamp the payment instrument was last updated in the container. The timestamp format is ISO8601.

lastUsed.description: The timestamp the payment instrument was last used in the container. The timestamp format is ISO8601. Will be null if never used.

primary.description: A flag to indicate if this payment instrument is the primary instrument in the container.

allowed.description: A flag to indicate if the merchant profile in the container allows the use of this payment instrument.

cardSuffix.description: The suffix (last 4 digits) of the gift card number.

type.description: The type of the step up action. For gift cards this will be REQUIRE_PASSCODE which identifies that the consumer must capture the PIN prior to payment.

mandatory.description: A flag to indicate if this step up (action) is mandatory.

cardCaptureURL.description: The URL of an iframe. This iframe is used to capture a credit card number, expiry and CVV

transactionRef.description: Container reference in the transaction logs. This number uniquely identifies the transaction in the container

termsAndConditionsAcceptances.description: An array of Ts and Cs the customer has accepted.

transactions.description: The resulting list of transactions.  If no results match the request then an empty array will be returned

payments.description: The resulting list of payments.  If no results match the request then an empty array will be returned

schemas.description: A list of IDs for the currently valid schemas for this merchant

quoteId.description: Quote reference. Can be used as a reference when placing the actual order

subTotalAmount.description: Face value of the gift card

discountAmount.description: Eligible discount amount. In case of no discounts, value will be 0

designId.description: Unique identifier of the design selected (assumed to be DIGITAL only currently)

amount.description: Face value of the gift card

unitPrice.description: Sale price of the gift card

quantity.description: For self use card, this can be any value between 1 and 10. For a gifting card, it must be 1

isGifting.description: If true its a gifting card, if false it is a self use card

mobileNumber.description: Australian mobile number of recipient. Only SMS delivery method is supported for gifting card
